attributes.action: Restore the Earnings Related Element and 12 month Non Means Tested Duration of Payment to Social Security Benefits, That Have been Bought and Paid For by UK Employees Since the Abolition of Flat Rate National Insurance Contributions in the 1970's.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the early 1970's the method by which UK employees paid for their Social Security benefits changed from a 'flat rate system' to an 'Earnings Related (ER)System' (The Current system).
In return for ER Contributions, the Benefits, inc OAP,UB and Sickness Benefit had to be paid in line with your earnings.

However since the late 1980's this link has been scrapped, and NICs are effectively an Income Tax on ALL your earnings, as no 'Tax Free' allowance is given. You also pay Income Tax on your NICs and if you are unlucky to be 'Unemployed' your benefit is also 'Taxable'!

So your Contributions INCREASED, but your benefits DECREASED.

You're also subjected to a 'Triple Whammy' of taxation on any benefits that you may receive.

Also UB was not 'means tested' until the contributor was 'out of work' for 12 months, (currently 6 months).

The exchequer receives in excess of £90bn in NI contributions every year.

It is now time to restore the 'original contract' and all of the ER benefits included therein!!
